description:
Check return of NSS CERT_CreateValidity.

BUG=142388
TEST=set system clock to year before 1950, run with --enable-origin-bound-certs, shouldn't crash

Committed: https://src.chromium.org/viewvc/chrome?view=rev&revision=153978

messages.text: (Note that this isn't enough to re-enable the trial, since the cert generation failing will still cause the TLS connection to abort.  I'm doing a separate change to NSS to address the underlying issue.)

CQ is trying da patch. Follow status at
https://chromium-status.appspot.com/cq/mattm@chromium.org/10896028/1

lgtm

https://chromiumcodereview.appspot.com/10896028/diff/1/net/base/x509_util_nss.cc
File net/base/x509_util_nss.cc (right):

https://chromiumcodereview.appspot.com/10896028/diff/1/net/base/x509_util_nss.cc#newcode105
net/base/x509_util_nss.cc:105: crypto::BaseTimeToPRTime(not_valid_after));

IMPORTANT: since we use system NSS libraries on Linux, we
need to add a test call of CERT_CreateValidity() with
sample not_valid_before and not_valid_after based on the
current time, and turn off the TLS Channel ID extension if
the CERT_CreateValidity() call fails. We can limit this test
to Linux (similar to how we detect ECDSA support).

Try job failure for 10896028-1 (retry) on linux_rel for step "interactive_ui_tests".
It's a second try, previously, step "interactive_ui_tests" failed.
http://build.chromium.org/p/tryserver.chromium/buildstatus?builder=linux_rel&number=51565

subject: Check return of NSS CERT_CreateValidity.
